attributes.action: Bring N.Ireland trailer laws in line with the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would help younger adults to become more employable in various industries across different sectors along with allowing laws to be less confusing to follow. UK laws shouldn't be so different, as areas with less favourable laws inevitably lead to people feeling segregated and forgotten about.
attributes.background: Review and update N.I trailer laws to match what was done in England and Wales in 2021.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about these laws in Northern Ireland are a matter for the Northern Ireland Executive and Northern Ireland Assembly, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want to raise this issue you could contact your MLA, or raise it with the Northern Ireland Executive.

You can find contact details for your MLAs here: http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/your-mlas/

You can find contact details for the departments of the Northern Ireland Executive here: https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/contacts/government-departments-in-northern-ireland
